Some foods can be left out in room temperature for periods of time and still be safe to eat without the risk for foodborne illness or food poisoning. While pizza should be refrigerated, whether or not it's cooked, leaving it out in room temperature for short periods of time is generally okay. Throw away any pizza that's been sitting out in room temperature for more than two hours. The FDA notes that if you keep leftover pizza in the freezer instead of the fridge, it's safe to keep it for one to two months.

Throw away any pizza that's been sitting out in room temperature for more than two hours.
